Topic.Title: romney creates jobs for OFF SHORE banker's

Message.Msg: "IF he made foreign investments from his off shore bank acct. he avoided income taxes on any gains from said investments. Maybe tax avoidance and not exactly ethical from that standpoint but it is certainly legal." No it isn't. American citizens are taxable on their worldwide income and foreign income is more heavily taxed, not less so. Your partisanship is cauing you to reach for facts that aren't.

Topic.Title: romney creates jobs for OFF SHORE banker's

Message.Msg: Fly, are you saying a U.S. Citizen who makes foreign investments from an offshore account is committing a crime?

Topic.Title: romney creates jobs for OFF SHORE banker's

Message.Msg: No! I am saying if he or she doesn't report the income from those investments and even in some cases the accretion in value, that is a crime. In this thread you stated an erroneous thought that income from offshore investments wasn't subject to US tax. It is. I have to doubt Romney would do anything that blatantly illegal, so I will go back to my earlier opinion in this thread that Romney's return may be legal, but would look awful to the American people. Repubs won't mind and neither will I, but some independents may be turned off. I think this is the calculus Team Romney has performed.
Thanks for the free video
